definition: to suspend/to hang up/to hang a person
ring/hoop/loop/(chain) link/classifier for scores in archery etc/to surround/to encircle/to hem in

sentences.english: This machine is called rings-type tackle.
sentences.chinese: 這種機器叫吊環型滑車。

sentences.english: Chen Yibing, the "lord of rings", has always kept a low profile and is modest.
sentences.chinese: “吊環王”陳一冰總是保持低調，並且很謙虛。

sentences.english: The hanging loop for this generation should also be made of the same twill tape.
sentences.chinese: 這個系列的所有吊環，都必須用同色系的斜紋布製作。

sentences.english: He invented several pieces of equipment including the parallel bars, the horizontal bar and the rings.
sentences.chinese: 他發明了一些體操器械，包括雙槓單槓和吊環。

sentences.english: The United States , on the still rings, was third.
sentences.chinese: 美國，選擇吊環，排列第三。

sentences.english: "Hoisting ring's king" rookie player Chen Yibing has demonstrated brilliant performance which made me clap the table.
sentences.chinese: “吊環王”小將陳一冰的精彩表現令我拍案叫絕。

sentences.english: They were already dangling a little because of the heat.
sentences.chinese: 因爲炎熱，他們都抓着吊環站着。

sentences.english: Only men perform on the rings, on the double bars, on the high bar.
sentences.chinese: 只有男人才能表演吊環，雙槓，高槓。
